preference.to: syntactic context - types ( dep and joint )
preference.from sentence:
Experiments
    Comparing Unsupervised Measures
    The results show preference to the syntactic context - types ( dep and joint ) , which might be explained by the fact that these contexts are richer ( as they contain both proximity and syntactic information ) and therefore more discriminative .

feature weighting.from sentence: In feature weighting there is no consistency , but interestingly , raw frequency appears to be successful in hypernymy detection , contrary to previously reported results for word similarity tasks , where PPMI was shown to outperform it .

on top.from sentence: The new SLQS variants are on top of the list in many settings .

in discriminating.from sentence: In particular they perform well in discriminating hypernyms from symmetric relations ( antonymy , synonymy , coordination ) .

concatenation method.with: either GloVe or the dependency - based embeddings

achieved using.from sentence:
Comparison to State - of - the - art Supervised Methods
    The over all performance of the embeddingbased classifiers is almost perfect , and in particular the best performance is achieved using the concatenation method with either GloVe or the dependency - based embeddings .

worse.from sentence: As expected , the unsupervised measures perform worse than the embedding - based classifiers , though generally not bad on their own .
